text: everybody knows the rice paper as the
vietnamese kitchen stable and its common
use is to make wrapper for spring rolls
today let's cut it up and put it to
another use that is to make salad in one
of the most popular street food snack in
ho chi minh city called banjang dong
like most salad banana drone is
customizable that's a loose template to
follow i will show you a few versions of
banjento in this video so you will have
an idea how versatile this dish could be
let's start with the more original
version of banjanjo with big turkey and
cray eggs you will need some green onion
10 pieces of rice paper 1 green mango 5
calamansi or kumquat some vietnamese
mint garlic quail eggs toasted dried
tiny shrimps shredded beef jerky some
roasted peanut shrimp salt sugar and
vegetable oil you also need some fried
shallots soy sauce vinegar and saute
your kitchen chairs to cut the rice
paper into strips
peel and julienne or shred the green
mango heat three tablespoons of
vegetable in a pan fry two tablespoons
of minced garlic until golden brown and
then transfer the garlic chips into a
bowl add the chopped scallion stir for a
few seconds and transfer to a bowl
to make the dressing for the salad you
will need a tablespoon of soy sauce a
tablespoon edge of vinegar and sugar
half a tablespoon of satay which is the
vietnamese fragrant and spicy chili
paste stir to dissolve now in a large
mixing bowl combine 100 gram of the
shredded rice paper half a cup of
shredded green mango a tablespoon of
fried shallots a tablespoon of toasted
dry shrimps three hard boiled quail eggs
some shrimp salt shred beef jerky
drizzle the dressing to your taste and
squid in about three to 4 kumquat a
tablespoon of the scallion oil put on
gloves and mix well add some natural oil
for more color and don't forget the
vietnamese mint you can freely adjust
the ingredients to your personal taste
just make sure that it has a balance of
flavors sweet sour savory and spicy
next version is
a simplified version of the original and
it requires a lot less ingredients but
you know sometimes simplicity could be
the ultimate sophistication
you will need rice paper garlic scallion
fry shallots some shrimp salt which is
optional some kind of chili paste or
satay
salt and peanuts cut the rice paper into
1 inch strips in a pan fry the minced
garlic until golden brown and transfer
the garlic chips into a bowl add the
chopped scallion quickly stir for a few
seconds and transfer to a bowl in a
lunch mixing bowl combine the shredded
rice paper with a sprinkles of shrimp
salt
a tablespoon of chili paste or satay
some scallion oil fried shallots and mix
well
when the rice paper is well coated with
the seasonings in the oil add roasted
peanuts and then transfer to a plate to
serve the amazing smell of the fried
garlic scallion oil and sate make this
simple salad so appetizing the fried
shallots and roasted peanuts as a
beautiful crunch and bits of scallion
add some freshness and color to the dish
you're gonna love this if you have some
kind of cheese powder in your pantry
make sure you try this banjan jong for
my it's so simple to make but tastes
incredible you will need some rice paper
some saute or chili paste chicken or
beef jerky or pop floss cheese batter
and salt or shrimp salt cut the rice
paper into square pieces about 2 inches
then mix the rice paper with some sweet
chili sauce or satay a sprinkle of
shrimp salt mix well so the rice paper
is well coated with the saute
sprinkle 2 tbsp of the cheese powder top
with some shredded jerkys or pot floss
of your choice such a quick snack that
you can put together in just a minute
but you're gonna love the cheesy flavors
melting in the soft and chewy rice
papers just irresistible if you're a fan
of the umami savory flavors of salted
egg then you can't miss the next version
it's called
muy or salted egg rice paper salad you
will need a stack of rice paper some
scallion 3 salted egg yolk toted rice
tiny shrimps some satay or sweet chilli
paste shrimp salt vietnamese mint or rum
and gumbo or lime juice finely shred the
rice paper rinse the sauteed egg yolk
with cooking wine to kill the strong
smell and then steam for about 10
minutes then crush finely with a fork
combine the rice paper with satay the
sauteed egg crumbles some toasted dry
shrimps a sprinkle of shrimp salt some
scallion oil and juice of two kumquats
add some chops vietnamese mint and toss
well ah so simple but super tasty
the last version is banjonjong with
tamarind sauce together with the green
mango tamarind become the main acidic
element making the salad extra flavorful
you will need about 5 pieces of rice
paper a green mango scallion oil
vietnamese mint quail egg beef jerky
tamarind fried garlic and shallot some
roasted peanuts with chili sauce or
saute some shrimp salt hot water and
sugar soak a tablespoon of tamarind in a
cup of hot water break it down with a
spoon or spatula and then strain to get
the tamarind juice saute some minced
garlic until fragrant add the tamarind
juice 3 tbsp of sugar stir well and
simmer until the sauce is slightly
thickened combine everything in the
salad bowl the rice paper scallion oil
roasted peanuts dry shrimps fried garlic
and shallot shrimp salt and a few
tablespoons of the tamarind sauce add
quail eggs and toss well then add
shredded green mango and chopped
vietnamese mint give it a final toss and
transfer to a plate to serve top with
some shredded beef jerky and there you
have it rice paper salad with tamarind
sauce the sweet and sour flavor of the
tamarind really make it into the
highlight i hope you enjoyed the five
versions of rice paper salads that i
make today if you liked the video don't
forget to give it a good thumbs up and
subscribe to my channel for more amazing
vietnamese recipes share this video with
your friends to enjoy the dish together
thank you for watching i will see you
then next time bye
